page.title: 08FARM INDUSTRY, CHULMLEIGH
page.content: At {Bycott Farm, Chulmleigh, can be found an example of a small farm machinery workshop. The farmland is used for grass and the land is then rented to local farmers. Along side this work the farmer employs three men who make a type of spraying machine which has been designed by the farmer himself. The firm known as{Bateman {Agricultural}advertises in the local press, farming magazines and by displaying the products at local Agricultural Shows. The sprayer which is called the Bateman Hilo is powered from the cab by an hydraulic boom control. The Hi Lo can be fitted with a boom length from 12 -24 metres. The machine has an all- wheel drive and four wheel steering which leaves only one set of tracks ,allowing easy access to crops.
